[[Paul Corfield Godfrey]]'s ''Tolkien Songs'' for voice and piano were written (and re-written) during the early 1970s and were all conceived as part of an extensive cycle on ''[[The Lord of the Rings]]'' and ''[[The Hobbit]]''.  The rights to these songs were granted by the estate as part of the ''Akallabêth and other Tolkien works'' album release.

They were all subsequently orchestrated.  ''In Western Lands'' was also incorporated into ''[[Beren and Lúthien, Op. 47 (Opera)]].''

== Songs ==
Strider

Song of the Eagle

Alive Without Breath

Drinking Song

In Western Lands 

Roads go ever ever on

== Recordings ==
Theses songs were included on Prima Facie's 2017 release ''Akallabêth and other Tolkien works.''


Volante Opera Productions have also recorded a video for Zarathustra: The Paul Corfield Music Trust of the orchestrated version of ''Drinking Song (''www.paulcorfieldgodfrey.co.uk/recordings).
